The United States has the highest corpor: ranking first out of the 34 countries in the OECD with a rate of 39.1 percent.
Two non: OECD countries, the United Arab Emirates and Chad, have higher statutory rates than the United States, but they may not fit into the "free world" category.
The effective tax rate: which takes into account tax deductions and other factors, is a valid measurement of corporate tax rates. Different organizations have published different estimates of the effective tax rate that corporations pay.
The World Bank and International Finance: effective tax rate for 2014 to be 27.9 percent, which is second highest among the countries analyzed.
